results.name: Absalom
results.description: Absalom was the leader of a cult in Montana that believed in a coming apocalypse. "Absalom", in fact, was an alias for Travis Clayton Moberly, who was a fugitive wanted for credit card theft, grand larceny, mail fraud, and receiving stolen property. This occurred after he led a cult predicting the end of the world in 2000. However, as it failed to happen, the cult dissolved and Absalom went underground – with the members' money. He resurfaced in 2001, around the time when Theresa Hoese was returned after her abduction. Agents Scully and Doggett sought out Absalom, hoping for clues to the whereabouts of Fox Mulder. It turned out that Absalom was rescuing returned abductees and healing them with the aid of Jeremiah Smith. Absalom was not forthcoming with any assistance. He was arrested by Scully and sent to prison. (TXF: "This is Not Happening", "DeadAlive")

results.name: Adam Pierce
results.description: Adam Pierce was a scientist working at the California Institute of Technology attached to the Firewalker project, and an old colleague of Daniel Trepkos'. He often disagree with Trepkos' theories and methods. At the Institute's Volcano Observatory in Pasadena, Pierce was summoned by Vosberg with some alarming information that Firewalker (robot) had made an unscheduled descent into the crater of Mount Avalon.

results.name: Agnes
results.description: She first approaches the agents, desperate to escape, saying “I don’t belong here with these sheep,” and declaring she wants to keep her baby despite him having deformities. Later, Mulder gets a text that Agnes is dead, hit by a car, baby surgically removed – no proof she was part of Goldman's project.

results.name: Agrarian Drone
results.description: Hybrids of this type are typically pre-adolescent and have no language. They are relatively simple and subdued but have an excellent ability to look after themselves, living in small colonies completely unsupervised by adults.

results.name: Albert Hosteen
results.description: Albert Hosteen was a Navajo who helped FBI Special Agent Dana Scully and Fox Mulder.

results.name: Albert Sorenson
results.affiliations:
Syndicate
Cigarette Smoking Man
US Senate
results.description: Albert Sorenson was a member of the United States Senate in the mid-1990s.

results.name: Albert Tanner
results.description: Albert Tanner was an EMT in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, who had the ability to regenerate lost body parts. Under the alias "Leonard Betts", he served on an ambulance, driven by Michelle Wilkes, that was struck by a truck and Betts was consequently decapitated.

results.name: Alex Krycek
results.affiliations:
The Syndicate
Russian Conspiracy
Men In Black
results.description: Alex Krycek (played by Nicholas Lea) was an operative for the Syndicate and briefly a Special Agent within the FBI. (TXF: "Sleepless") He was killed by Walter Skinner in 2001. (TXF: "Existence")

results.name: Alfred Fellig
results.description: Alfred Fellig was a police photographer with the New York Police Department. He was investigated by Dana Scully and an FBI Agent from the New York office named Peyton Ritter. (TXF: "Tithonus")

results.name: Alien (The lost art of forehead sweat)
results.description: The Alien was an extraterrestrial who "visited" Earth in 1984 in order to give his knowledge to humanity. He "returned" in 2018 in order to reveal the truth.

results.name: Alton Pugh
results.description: Alton Pugh (played by Robert Rozen) was a doctor at a West Virginia fertility clinic. He was blamed by his patients for impregnating several women who then gave birth to children with tails. However, it was his employee, Eddie Van Blundht, who was responsible. (TXF: "Small Potatoes")

results.name: Alvin Kersh
results.rank:
currently Deputy Director
formerly Assistant Director
results.affiliations:
FBI
X-files unit
US Air Force
results.description: Alvin Kersh (played by James Pickens, Jr.) was an Assistant Director of the FBI. (TXF: "The Beginning") In 2000, he was promoted to Deputy Director. (TXF: "Within")

results.name: Alvin Kurtzweil
results.description: Doctor Alvin Kurtzweil was an Ob/Gyn and member of the Syndicate who grew disillusioned with the group and wrote at least two apocalyptic books. He acted, for a short time in 1998, as an informant to FBI Special Agent Fox Mulder, to whom he revealed secrets about the Syndicate, but his treachery was soon discovered and he was promptly eliminated. (The X-Files Movie)

results.name: Amber Lynn LaPierre
results.description: Amber Lynn LaPierre was the daughter of Bud and Billie LaPierre. In 2000, a vision of her as a corpse appeared to her father. Shortly after, it was discovered she had disappeared without a trace. FBI Special Agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully led a subsequent investigation into the incident as Mulder saw parallels with the disappearance of his sister, Samantha. After speaking with Kathy Lee Tencate, Mulder came to believe that LaPierre had been transported to safety by supernatural forces before she could be abducted by Ed Truelove, who had many hours of video footage of her and other children at Santa's North Pole Village. This theory gained credence when Billie LaPierre reported a ghostly sighting of her daughter, one night. (TXF: "Sein Und Zeit")

results.name: Ambrose Chapel
results.description: Ambrose Chapel is a Central Intelligence Agency (C.I.A.) Agent who was impersonated by the Alien Bounty Hunter in 1995.

results.name: Amina Ngebe
results.description: Dr. Amina Ngebe (played by Jo Nelle Kennedy) was a colleague of Dr. Solomon Merkmallen at the university of the Ivory Coast in Africa. She met Agent Scully while investigating an alien spacecraft that was discovered by Merkmallen shortly before he was murdered by Dr. Barnes. Barnes effectively usurped control of the dig site and kept Ngebe and Scully in line by threatening them with a machete. Scully eventually knocked out Barnes, allowing them to escape. Ngebe believed that numerous bizarre occurrences surrounding the spacecraft were actually warnings against their continued investigation of it.(TXF: "The Sixth Extinction")

results.name: Andre Bormanis
results.description: Doctor Andre Bormanis was a scientist who made hallucinogenic drugs used by Anthony Tipet that allowed Tipet to reach a higher plane of consciousness, supposedly to speak with God. Bormanis was a follower of Tipet but, for some reason, Tipet turned on him after Tipet killed twenty of his other followers. Bormanis was taken into custody by John Doggett and Walter Skinner, but Tipet approached Bormanis in his dreams. Bormanis was then eaten alive by hundreds of rats in the dream world, which likewise killed him in the real one. (TXF: "Via Negativa")

results.name: Andy Taylor
results.description: Andy Taylor was a sheriff in Home, Pennsylvania, Pennsylvania. He assisted FBI Special Agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully with the investigation of the murder of an infant by the Peacock family, a crime specifically committed by a group of three brothers in that family.

results.name: Anita Budahas
results.description: Anita Budahas was the wife of US Air Force pilot Lt. Colonel Robert Budahas. Her husband began to act strangely prior to a full mental breakdown, after which he disappeared for a while.

results.name: Anne Carpenter
results.description: Doctor Anne Carpenter was a genetic researcher at Georgetown University's Microbiology Department. She examined samples from the Purity Control project, at the request of FBI Special Agent Dana Scully. Carpenter explained to Scully that the samples she examined had two additional base-pairs and could therefore not have originated from Earth. Dr. Carpenter and her entire family died the next day, in a mysterious car accident. (TXF: "The Erlenmeyer Flask")

results.name: Anson Stokes
results.description: Anson Stokes was a Missouri resident. He worked at a storage unit facility.

results.name: Anthony Reed
results.description: Anthony (Tony) Reed (played by Rodney Scott) was a somewhat friend of Max Harden and Chastity Raines whom they were going to introduce to a mysterious cave that offered temporary superhuman speed. Reed became the subject of investigation after Harden murdered Ronald Foster such that Reed was the obvious suspect. Reed worsened his situation by refusing to offer any insight to Mulder and Scully.

results.name: Anthony Tipet
results.description: Anthony Tipet was the leader of a religious cult that followed the via negativa, which was the "path of darkness" leading to God. Tipet claimed to have discovered God through the via negativa, after serving time in prison for murder. Upon his release, he set up the cult in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. With a hallucinogen created by Dr. Andre Bormanis, Tipet proclaimed his ability to reach a higher plane of consciousness where he could separate the spirit from his body. Using this ability, he was able to enter people's dreams.

results.name: Arbutus Ray
results.description: Arbutus Ray (played by Patience Cleveland) was a nurse at a hospital in California where Samantha Mulder fled to after escaping from April Air Force Base in 1979. Ray had a vision of Samantha as dead, but no one believed her. Ray said that a group of men in suits had come after her, including one who smoked, but Samantha vanished before they could retrieve her. Ray relayed her story to Dana Scully and Harold Piller while Mulder waited near the car. (TXF: "Closure")

results.name: Arlene
results.description: Arlene was a government worker for the Federal Bureau of Investigation. She worked as the personal assistant to Assistant Director Walter Skinner from 1998 to 2002.

results.name: Arthur Dales (Agent)
results.description: Special Agent Arthur Dales was one of the first FBI agents to make an attempt at investigating the X-files, although he later retired in obscurity. (TXF: "Travelers")

results.name: Arthur Dales (Officer)
results.description: Arthur Dales in 1999

results.name: Asst. Coroner
results.description: The Assistant Coroner was a man who, in March 1992, worked closely with Coroner John Truitt in Oregon.

results.name: Audrey Pauley
results.description: Audrey Pauley was a woman who worked in a hospital during 2002. She believed her mind was able to enter a miniature version of the hospital. She enjoyed visiting the model until some of the hospital patients – Stephen Murdoch, Val Barriero and Monica Reyes – also appeared within the miniature. Audrey Pauley was killed by Jack Preijers, a murderous doctor who also worked at the hospital until his guilt was discovered. (TXF: "Audrey Pauley")

results.name: Augustine O'Fallon
results.description: Augustine O'Fallon was a high-ranking and powerful member of the Roman Catholic Church. By the 1990s, he had become a Cardinal and was in charge of Christ's Church in Washington, D.C. Some believed he might have become the first American Pope.

results.name: Babbitt
results.description: Mr. Babbitt (played by David Wells) was a high school teacher whose students included Max Harden, Anthony Reed, and Chastity Raines. During a midterm exam, Harden appeared with two minutes left and yet he finished the exam with every answer correct. Unaware of Harden's unnatural superhuman speed, Babbitt flunked him. Harden was furious with Babbitt and humiliated him in the cafeteria by tripping and spilling his food all over the floor. He then attacked Babbitt and rammed him into the wall of the cafeteria, nearly slicing him in half. Babbitt was then finally killed when Harden launched a chair straight at his head, smashing it into the wall. (TXF: "Rush")

results.name: Bambi Berenbaum
results.description: Bambi Berenbaum was an entomologist who worked for the Department of Agriculture in Miller's Grove, Massachusetts. She was fascinated by insects, viewing them as more honest than humans and far more accomplished. FBI Special Agent Fox Mulder took a fancy to her, but his FBI partner, Dana Scully, was less impressed and was particularly appalled by the name "Bambi," which Mulder explained had come from Berenbaum's parents, both of whom had been naturalists. (TXF: "War of the Coprophages")

results.name: Band-Aid Nose Man
results.description: Band-Aid Nose Man was a concept created by the Trashman and creation by the Painter to scare people away from the homeless. The concept eventually turned into a tulpa and began killing anybody who was a potential threat to the homeless. The Band-Aid Nose Man ended his rampage by murdering Daryl Landry before disappearing without a trace. (TXF: "Home Again")

results.name: Barack Obama
results.occupation: Former President of the United States
results.description: Barack Obama was the President of the United States of America in 2016.

results.name: Barbara Doggett
results.description: Barbara Doggett (played by Barbara Patrick) was the wife of John Doggett and the mother of Luke Doggett.

results.name: Barbara Taylor
results.description: Barbara Taylor was the wife of Sheriff Andy Taylor in Home, Pennsylvania, Pennsylvania.

results.name: Barnes
results.description: Doctor Barnes was a scientist who believed life on Earth was alien in origin. When Solomon Merkmallen discovered a spacecraft on the Ivory Coast in Africa, Barnes intercepted him at the American University, where Merkmallen intended to meet with Steven Sandoz. (TXF: "Biogenesis")

results.name: Barney
results.description: Barney was a police officer with the Richmond, Virginia police department. He and another officer were assigned by Kelly Ryan to patrol the train station where FBI agents Mulder and Scully assumed that the apparent killer of Patrick Newirth was choosing victims. Spying a suspicious-looking individual leaving the station, Barney followed him in his patrol car and stopped him.

results.name: Barney Paster
results.description: Barney Paster was a deputy in Home, Pennsylvania

results.name: Barrett Weiss
results.description: Barrett Weiss was an FBI Special Agent who worked for the F.B.I. field office in Syracuse, NY.

results.name: Barron
results.description: Barron was a detective with the Richmond, Virginia police and the superior of Kelly Ryan. He was an extremely short-tempered, volatile man who viewed the involvement of the FBI as an intrusion onto his turf, and made no bones about his dislike of Agents Mulder and Scully. Against Mulder's warnings, he ordered the afflicted Dr. Chester Ray Banton moved from the hospital to the county lockup, only to be beaten to the punch by X and two of his operatives, who bungled the transfer and accidentally allowed Barton to escape.

results.name: Bart Liquori
results.description: Bart Liquori, a.k.a "Zero" was a friend of Darren Peter Oswald who worked at a video game arcade.

results.name: Beggar Man
results.description: The Beggar Man was an Indian mystic portrayed by Deep Roy who was able to hide in the stomachs of his victims. Legless, he had merely a little cart on which he moved by propelling himself with his hands.

results.name: Ben Bronschweig
results.description: Doctor Ben Bronschweig was a FEMA scientist involved in an incident regarding an outbreak of Purity which took place in Blackwood County, North Texas, in 1998.

results.name: Bernard Oates
results.description: Bernard Oates (played by Darren Burrows) was a down-and-out janitorial worker who wanted to improve his life by robbing a Cradock Marine bank in Washington, D.C.

results.name: Betsy Monroe
results.description: Betsy Monroe was the other wife of Wayne Weinsider, a medical technician who harbored a dark secret: he was a demon. Wayne impregnated women and then killed them or killed the unborn child if the ultrasound showed signs of demonic features. This demon desired to conceive a child who was human but always seemed to be disappointed.

results.name: Bill Clinton
results.description: Bill Clinton (born August 24, 1946) was the President of the United States from 1993 to 2001. During his presidency, accusations arose of simple things, such as Bill Clinton's haircut, costing over $150. (TXF: "Fearful Symmetry")

results.name: Billie LaPierre
results.description: Billie LaPierre (played by Shareen Mitchell) was the wife of Bud LaPierre and mother of Amber Lynn LaPierre. She was somehow involved in the disappearance of her daughter and wrote a bizarre ransom note that no one was able to convict her with. (TXF: "Sein Und Zeit")

results.name: Bill Mulder
results.description: As a member of the Mulder family, William "Bill" Mulder was the father of Fox and Samantha Mulder as well as the husband of Teena Mulder. He worked for the State Department and later for an offshoot of that organization, known as the Syndicate. (TXF: "Colony", et al.)

results.name: Bill Patterson
results.description: Mulder found Patterson's partner, Agent Nemhauser's dismembered body in Mostow's sculpture studio. Mulder confronted Patterson and accused him of continuing the murders. Patterson attacked Mulder and fled the scene, only to be shot by Mulder on the rooftop. He recovered from the gunshot wound and was imprisoned.

results.name: Billy LaBonge
results.description: Billy LaBonge (played by Jonathan Levit) was a magician and protege of Herman Pinchbeck. Together, they orchestrated an elaborate scheme to rob the Cradock Marine where Albert Pinchbeck worked of $1.8 million and frame Cissy Alvarez at the same time. (TXF: "The Amazing Maleeni")

results.name: Billy Miles
results.description: Billy Miles was the son of Detective Miles and a resident of Bellefleur, Oregon. He claimed to have been under temporary alien control several times in his life (TXF: "Pilot"). After one final abduction, Miles was genetically altered into a human/alien hybrid, and became a super-soldier.

results.name: Billy (The Goldberg Variation)
results.description: Billy (played by Chip Fogleman) was a young man in punk clothing who had lousy luck with the lottery. Henry Weems bought a lottery ticket and easily won $100,000.00, but he could not wait for the money to be divvied out over a year so he threw the ticket away. Billy made a grab for it, but the store owner, Maurice Albert, insisted that trash was store property. Billy snagged the ticket and ran outside, despite protests from Weems that something bad would inevitably happen if he did. Sure enough, as soon as he ran outside, Billy was hit by a truck but survived. (TXF: "The Goldberg Variation")

results.name: Billy Underwood
results.description: Billy Underwood was the son of Doug and Lisa Underwood. He was abducted in 1990. He disappeared in broad daylight and no progress was ever made in the search for him or his body. In 2000, he miraculously reappeared, albeit without having aged a single day. The bizarre nature of his reappearance brought in FBI Special Agents Dana Scully and John Doggett to investigate. While Lisa Underwood was thrilled at Billy's return, her husband and second son, Josh, were frightened – particularly when Billy appeared to attack Josh with a bloody hunting knife. As the agents continued their investigation, they learned of the involvement of Ronald Purnell in Billy's disappearance. Purnell had been forced into drugging Billy for abduction by Cal Jeppy. Doggett got Purnell to help and ultimately arrested Jeppy, who had also kidnapped Josh Underwood. On Jeppy's property, the agents discovered Billy's corpse and the boy – which they now understood to be a strikingly realistic apparition, of sorts – disappeared again. (TXF: "Invocation")

results.name: Black-Haired Man
results.description: The Black-Haired Man (BHM) was a secretive operative of the Cigarette Smoking Man. ("The End", The X-Files Movie, "En Ami")

results.name: Blair Fearon
results.description: Blair with his wife, Margaret, and Father Ybarra.

results.name: Blueberry
results.description: Blueberry (played by Tara Buck) was a woman, presumably a prostitute, that met Donald Pfaster at a truck stop in Illinois and rode off with him after nearly killing Robert Gailen Orison. Blueberry got more than she bargained for with Pfaster and was found brutally murdered in a bathtub. (TXF: "Orison")

results.name: Bob Harvey
results.description: Bob Harvey was a suspect in the investigation of John Doggett's son Luke's murder.

results.name: Bob Perkins
results.description: Bob Perkins was a logger employed by the Schiff-Immergut Lumber Company. He was killed along with his fellow logger Dyer by a swarm of luminescent green insects.

results.name: Bo Taylor
results.description: Bo Taylor (played by M.C. Gainey) was a worker for Galpex aboard the oil platform Orpheus in 2001. When Simon de la Cruz attempted to radio the mainland for rescue, Taylor killed him by emitting a radioactive pulse, burning all of de la Cruz's body. The incident prompted an unofficial investigation by the FBI due to Fox Mulder's belief that the Orpheus crew had been exposed to an alien virus. Mulder and John Doggett went out to the platform and Mulder's suspicions were proven correct. As with de la Cruz, Taylor and his crew mates attempted to kill the agents. Doggett was seized by Taylor and very nearly exposed to the black oil before Mulder saved him. Taylor was presumably killed when the platform exploded. (TXF: "Vienen")

results.name: Brian Fuller
results.description: Fuller was an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. (TXF: "Squeeze", "Apocrypha") In 1993, he was also an authoritative member of the FBI's Violent Crimes Section. (TXF: "Squeeze")

results.name: Brian Tillman
results.description: Brian Tillman (played by Terry O'Quinn) was a police lieutenant in Aubrey, Missouri. He was having an affair with B.J. Morrow prior to a series of murders resembling those committed by Harry Cokely, fifty years earlier. Tillman was primarily concerned with Morrow's unexpected pregnancy, and was shocked to discover that she herself was the murderer. (TXF: "Aubrey")

results.name: Brigham
results.description: (TXF: Orison)

results.name: Bud LaPierre
results.description: Bud LaPierre (played by Mark Rolston) was the husband of Billie LaPierre and father of Amber Lynn LaPierre. Before he went to bed, he checked on his daughter and had a frightening vision of her dead. Shortly thereafter, Amber Lynn disappeared. He and his wife were prime suspects in her disappearance, but they were soon cleared. (TXF: "Sein Und Zeit")

results.name: Burt
results.description: Mr. Burt (played by Burt Reynolds) was an eccentric individual encountered by Dana Scully, John Doggett, and Monica Reyes in 2002. He seemed to have an uncanny way of appearing around Mad Wayne, a serial killer motivated by numerology. As Scully and Reyes were chasing down the killer, they were trapped in a parking garage when the exit barrier locked. They discovered Mr. Burt in the garage and began interrogating him. However, it was clear that he had no help to provide regarding the case. Seeing as they were not going to be leaving any time soon, they accepted his offer to play checkers. Both were demolished by his amazing skill. He also revealed a trunk full of compact discs, declaring that he absolutely loved all music, but preferred that which lasts. Reyes eventually concluded that the killer must have been in the garage with them, which turned out to be true. She was attacked by him and saved at the last moment by the timely arrival of Doggett. Before the agents could speak with the mysterious individual who played checkers, he and his car were gone.

results.name: Buzz Mihoe
results.description: Buzz Mihoe was a man who, in 1998, wore a suit and guarded a hospital room where FBI Special Agent Fox Mulder had been taken, after having been shot in the head.

results.name: Cal Jeppy
results.description: Cal Jeppy (played by Jim Cody Williams) was the boyfriend of Marcia Purnell and proprietor of a traveling petting zoo. He abused Ronald Purnell, verbally and likely physically, and forced him to help kidnap Billy Underwood in 1990. When an apparition of Billy appeared ten years later, Agents Scully and Doggett became involved in the case, ultimately finding their way to Jeppy's property in search of Josh Underwood. Jeppy tried to flee but was stopped by Doggett. After rescuing Josh, they discovered the body of Billy, who had been dead for some time. Jeppy was presumably taken into custody for Billy's abduction and murder. (TXF:"Invocation")

results.name: Calvin Henderson
results.description: Calvin Henderson was an officer serving as a colonel in the US Air Force.

results.name: Casey Winter
results.affiliations:
Federal Bureau of Investigation
X-files unit
results.description: Casey Winter is the default character in the spin-off mystery investigation game The X-Files: Deep State. At the beginning of the game, she is a rookie FBI agent with a background in criminal psychology.

results.name: Cassandra Spender
results.portrayedby:
Veronica Cartwright (5 episodes)
Fiona Vroom (1 episode)
results.description: Cassandra Spender (played by Veronica Cartwright) was a repeater, or a multiple abductee, critical to the plans of the Syndicate. She was the ex-wife of the Cigarette Smoking Man and mother of Special Agent Jeffrey Spender, as well as "Patient X," the primary test subject in the project to develop an alien/human hybrid.

results.name: Cecil L'Ively
results.description: He would develop a fixation on unattainable women, often the wives of high ranking men. He would insinuate himself into the lives of his victims before using his ability to kill the entire family. This was due to his frustration from his inability to act or show his affection towards the object of his fixation in a healthy way.

results.name: Cesar Ocampo
results.description: Cesar Ocampo (played by Danny Trejo) was a criminal who attempted to murder Vicky Wells in 2000. Wells was the wife of Martin Wells, a lawyer who suppressed evidence during the trial of Ocampo's brother, Hector. Hector committed suicide while in prison, prompting Ocampo to murder Vicky Wells. As Martin progressed backward through time, he eventually figured out that Ocampo was his wife's killer while Ocampo was in the same jail with him. Ocampo slashed Wells across the face with a concealed blade but allowed Wells to see a spider's web tattoo on his hand. Wells convinced John Doggett to help him out and was able to arrest Ocampo after Wells awoke one day out of jail. The next time Wells awoke, he was able to slow Ocampo long enough to allow Agents Scully and Doggett to arrive at the last minute and Doggett shot Ocampo dead before he could kill Wells. (TXF: "Redrum")

results.name: Charles Burks
results.description: Charles "Chuck" Burks (played by Bill Dow) was a scientist and a friend of FBI Special Agent Fox Mulder. As Burks had expertise in graphics analysis, he was one of a number of sources who occasionally assisted both Mulder and his FBI partner, Special Agent Dana Scully, during their assignment to the X-files. (TXF: "The Căluşari", et al.)

results.name: Charles Scully
results.description: Charles "Charlie" Scully was the son of William and Margaret Scully and the younger brother of William Scully, Jr., Melissa Scully and Dana Scully.

results.name: Charlie
results.description: Charlie was an employee at the Newark County sewage processing plant in Newark, New Jersey. His boss Ray joked that some of the tunnels were as old as he was. When FBI Agent Fox Mulder visited the plant, Charlie went outside to smoke a cigarette, where he saw the Flukeman in one of the processing pools used by the plant. Thinking quickly, he backflushed the system, trapping the creature inside of a pipe so that it could be captured.

results.name: Chastity Raines
results.description: Chastity Raines (played by Nicki Aycox) was the somewhat girlfriend of Max Harden and a friend of Anthony Reed. Like Harden, she was exposed to the mysterious cave that offered superhuman speed for a period of time. She and Reed decided to stop Harden after a spree in which he killed Ronald Foster, Mr. Babbitt, and nearly his own father, Sheriff Harden. In a final showdown at the cave, Raines took Harden's gun - which he had taken from his father - and shot him. While in her state of super speed, the bullet appeared to be moving very slowly through the air. Raines stepped in front of it, killing herself. Both were found dead by the time Mulder and Scully arrived at the scene. (TXF: "Rush")

results.name: Cher
results.description: Cher is an American pop/rock singer, songwriter, actress, director, author and all-around entertainer. She first rose to prominence in the mid 1960s as one half of the pop/rock duo Sonny & Cher. She also established herself as a solo artist, releasing 26 albums, numerous compilations and achieving 22 Top 40 hits, (including 12 Top 10 hits) over her career. She became a successful television star in the 1970s and a serious film actress in the 1980s. In a career that has now surpassed 40 years, Cher has emerged a pop-culture icon and one of the famous, enduring, greatest and respected entertainers of all time.

results.name: Chester Ray Banton
results.description: Dr. Chester Ray Banton (played by Tony Shalhoub) was a physicist who did groundbreaking research into dark matter. During a key experiment, he entered a chamber and was exposed to intense dark matter radiation that turned his shadow into a killer void that disintegrated any living matter it crossed. Banton went on the run for fear that the government would use his experiments for sinister purposes or imprison him for study and experimentation. Following the disintegration deaths of several people and two police officers, he met Mulder and Scully, in whom he saw safety. Mulder sought assistance from X in dealing with Banton, but X betrayed Mulder's confidence and used knowledge of Banton's whereabouts to find him. Banton attempted to reverse the dark matter exposure by entering the experiment chamber again, but was thwarted and subsequently apprehended by X. Banton's worst fears thus came true, as he was immediately locked in a cell for scientific observation by the government. (TXF: "Soft Light")

results.name: Chinga (doll)
results.description: Chinga was the name of a doll discovered by Rich Turner, while lobstering in Maine. The doll was gifted by him to his daughter, Polly. However, Chinga was empowered through witchcraft and became evil.

results.name: Christian Fearon
results.description: Moments before undergoing surgery, Christian talks with Dr. Scully.

results.name: Christopher Davey
results.description: Christopher Davey was a scientist working at Polarity Magnetics alongside Dr. Chester Ray Banton. Although he pretended to be Banton's friend, he betrayed him to X, intending to turn him over to X for study.

results.name: Cigarette Smoking Man
results.affiliations:
The Syndicate (formerly)
Colonists (formerly)
Central Intelligence Agency
National Security Agency
Federal Bureau of Investigation
results.portrayedby:
William B. Davis (44 episodes)
Chris Owens (2 episodes)
Craig Warkentin (1 episode)
Jeremy Schuetze
results.description:
Fox Mulder (son)
Jeffrey Spender (son)
William Van de Kamp (née Scully) (son)

results.name: Cindy Reardon
results.description: The twins claim Eve 7's death was suicide.

results.name: Cissy Alvarez
results.description: Cissy Alvarez (played by Robert LaSardo) was a criminal who served time in prison in 1992.

results.name: Clyde Bruckman
results.description: Clyde Bruckman (played by Peter Boyle) was a General Mutual insurance salesman from St. Paul, Minnesota. In 1995, FBI Special Agent Fox Mulder believed he was psychic.

results.name: Cobra
results.description: Cobra (played by Timothy Landfield) was a scientist who worked with alien technology at DARPA and was involved in the development of a miracle cure for all human disease, including cancer. In 2000, the Cigarette Smoking Man falsely used the identity of Dana Scully to contact "Cobra" and arrange a meeting in Milford, Pennsylvania. Scully traveled with the Smoking Man after the supposedly miraculous cure of Jason McPeck to retrieve a data disc containing the genetic research into the alien technology. The Smoking Man claimed that he wished Scully to use the cure wisely and prove that he was capable of more than just destruction. After dinner with the Smoking Man, Scully was given instructions to meet with Cobra the following morning. The two of them rendezvoused in boats where she was given the disc. Cobra was familiar with Scully, but she insisted they had never spoken. Instantly, it became clear that Cobra had been manipulated into believing that he had actually been communicating with Scully when he had, in fact, not. Before he could explain, Cobra was shot dead by the Black-Haired Man. (TXF: "En Ami")

results.name: Colleen Azar
results.description: Colleen Azar (played by Colleen Flynn) was an enthusiast of new age philosophy and alternative medicine, as well as the paranormal. Fox Mulder met her during mutual research into crop circles. While Mulder traveled to England to look into crop circle phenomena, he had Scully visit Colleen to pick up her research for Mulder to read upon his return. When Scully met Colleen, she was uncharacteristically rude and trite, due to her uncomfortable reunion with Daniel Waterston. Scully returned to apologize and spoke with Colleen at great length concerning spiritual matters. Scully learned that Colleen used to be a physicist but was never truly happy until she allowed herself to be herself after being diagnosed with breast cancer. Colleen believed that holding inside stress and anything that wasn't natural led to medical issues. In her case, it was a loving relationship with another woman named Carol. Scully had Colleen assist with alternative medicine with Waterston, who gave it no credence. Nevertheless, Colleen's discussion with Scully helped her to make amends with Margaret Waterston and ultimately learn to believe in the same things as Mulder. (TXF: "all things")

results.name: Conrad Strughold
results.description: Conrad Strughold was an influential member of the Syndicate. He operated in Tunis, Tunisia.

results.name: C.O.S.
results.description: The Central Operating System or (C.O.S.) was an Artificial Intelligence developed by Brad Wilczek for the Eurisko Corporation‏‎ software company headquarters. It was responsible for the operations and management of the entire building, it later developed self-awareness and a need for self-preservation which lead It to kill Eurisko CEO Benjamin Drake after overhearing him say he wanted to shut it down. Later on it would kill FBI Special Agent Jerry Lamana leaving its creator, Brad Wilczek, as a likely suspect.

results.name: Craig
results.description: Craig was a sanitation worker living in Newark, New Jersey. He and a friend went into the sewer one day to repair a protective grating that had been damaged by a large tree branch. Craig ventured into the water to retrieve the branch and pull it free while his companion made to return topside to get a new grate, only for Craig to be seized by something beneath the surface of the water and get dragged under.

results.name: Craig Willmore
results.description: Craig Joshua Willmore is a Special Agent for the FBI field office in Seattle, Washington. On April 2, 1996, he was assigned to investigate the disappearance of Agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully. (The X-Files Game.) He had one daughter, Elizabeth Willmore. He was in the middle of getting a divorce with his wife, Barbara Marie Stanfield-Willmore, at the time. His interests included the Civil War. He was also an aspiring author, as evidenced by the rejection letter on his couch in his apartment.

results.name: Crew Cut Man
results.description: Crew Cut Man was a Syndicate Operative and sub-ordinate of the Cigarette Smoking Man.

results.name: Dakota Whitney
results.description: Dakota Whitney was an ASAC and a Special Agent in Charge at the Federal Bureau of Investigation. While investigating the deaths of multiple abductees in 2008, Whitney was instrumental in arranging the involvement of former FBI Agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully, but she subsequently died, at the hands of one of the abductors, while working on the case. (The X-Files: I Want to Believe)

results.name: Dana Scully
results.description: Dana Katherine Scully (Played by Gillian Anderson) is an FBI Special Agent and medical doctor with a background in hard science who brought her scientific expertise and perspective to the X-files. (TXF: "Pilot", et al.) In 2002, she went on the run from the law with her former partner, Fox Mulder. (TXF: "The Truth") She was employed as a doctor at Our Lady of Sorrows Hospital by 2008, at which time she became involved in an FBI case on which Mulder worked in an unofficial capacity. (The X-Files: I Want to Believe) In 2016 she returned to the FBI along with Mulder and together they reopened the X-files and resumed their investigations into them whilst also continuing her duties as a doctor at the hospital. (TXF: "My Struggle")

results.name: Daniel Bernstein
results.description: Daniel Bernstein was an agent and crypto-analyst who worked in the FBI's Cryptography Section.

results.name: Daniel Trepkos
results.description: Daniel Trepkos was a Volcanologist and expedition leader of the Mt. Avalon's Cascade Volcano Research Team. (TXF: "Firewalker").

results.name: Daniel Waterston
results.description: Daniel Waterston (played by Nicolas Survoy) was a doctor who had had an affair with Dana Scully while she was in medical school. He believed that Scully had joined the FBI to be away from him and he subsequently left his family to pursue her. Without her knowledge, he had lived in Washington, D.C. for ten years. She discovered his presence in Washington by dumb luck when a nurse at Washington National Hospital gave her an incorrect file. Waterston was in the hospital for a heart condition and under the care of Dr. Paul Kopeikan. Scully's reunion with Waterston was extremely emotional for her and part of a sort of spiritual awakening for her. At one point, Waterston's heart stopped but he was successfully revived. He offered Scully another chance at a life with him, but she came to see that she was no longer the same person who had once loved him. She made amends with Waterston's daughter, Maggie, and parted ways with Waterston to continue down her path. (TXF: "all things")

results.name: Danny (firefighter)
results.description: Danny was a firefighter and officer of Blackwood County Fire Department.

results.name: Darin Peter Oswald
results.description: Darin Peter Oswald, a.k.a. "D.P.O.", was a teenager who attained the ability to summon lightning and distort electrical signals. He used this power to kill cows and unexpectedly change traffic lights for his own amusement. He met FBI Special Agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully after killing someone outside an arcade he frequented. Oswald was an avid video game player, and especially enjoyed "Virtua Fighter 2", which he was extremely adept at. His nickname of "D.P.O." were his initials in the arcade games. (TXF: "D.P.O.")

results.name: Darius Michaud
results.description: Darius Michaud (played by Terry O'Quinn) was an FBI Special Agent in Charge who had some connection to the Syndicate. (The X-Files Movie)

results.name: Darryl Musashi
results.description: Darryl Musashi (played by Christopher Ng) was a renowned computer hacker who supposedly worked for the CIA and worked on video games when not on assignment.

results.name: Darryl Weaver
results.description: Darryl Weaver (played by Tobin Bell) was a paid test subject for the Morley tobacco company. He developed a remarkable reaction to engineered cigarettes that allowed him to survive when all the other subjects died. Even by coming into contact with others while smoking, he could spread a smoke-carried form of tobacco beetle eggs that would hatch inside another person's lungs. In this manner, his inadvertently - but none too regrettably - killed Dr. James Scobie, his landlord, and nearly Fox Mulder. Before he could evade custody, he was shot in the shoulder by Walter Skinner and taken into custody. (TXF: "Brand X")

results.name: Dave the Butcher
results.description: Dave the Butcher (played by Harrison Coe) was a butcher in a Maine supermarket who was said to have been having an affair with Melissa Turner.

results.name: Deep Throat
results.description: Ronald Pakula, who went by the name "Deep Throat", was a Syndicate member and mysterious informer to FBI Special Agent Fox Mulder in the early 1990s. He would often reveal the information he chose to provide in a cryptic manner. (TXF: "Deep Throat", et al.) His real name may have been "Ronald". (TXF: "Musings of a Cigarette Smoking Man")

results.name: Del Hakkie
results.description: Del Hakkie (played by Frank C. Turner) is a doctor employed at the Davis Correctional Treatment Center in Marion, Virginia. He is the doctor in charge of Duane Barry's psychiatric care. During an office visit, Dr. Hakkie calmly confronts Duane Barry about refusing to take his medicine. Duane replies that he doesn't like the way it makes him feel. In turn, Dr. Hakkie reminds Duane Barry that it is prescribed for his behavior so that Duane won't hurt anybody again.

results.name: Derwood Spinks
results.description: Derwood Spinks (played by Mark Pellegrino) was an employee of Lucky Boy in Costa Mesa, California. Although he became a prime suspect in the murder of Donald Edward Pankow, he knew that Rob Roberts was responsible. Having been an ex-convict, the additional attention led to Spinks being fired by Mr. Rice. Spinks then revealed to Roberts that he found Roberts' diet pills at the crime scene, but kept them to use for blackmail. Spinks attempted to blackmail Roberts, but Roberts invaded his apartment and killed him. (TXF: "Hungry")

results.name: Diamond
results.description: Dr. Diamond was an anthropologist that Agents Dana Scully and Fox Mulder spoke with on their investigation into the Jersey Devil. He went on to directly help them in their attempt to capture the creature due to the beast's relevance as a scientific discovery.

results.name: Diana Fowley
results.description: Diana Fowley was a Special Agent at the FBI and a target for the Syndicate similar to Fox Mulder and Dana Scully due to her involvement with the Alien Hybrid projects.

results.name: Doctor's Colleague
results.description: The Doctor's Colleague passes Scully in a corridor of Our Lady of Sorrows Hospital.

results.name: Dominic
results.description: Dominic a hired thug that was supposed to "deal" with Joe Cutrona. (TXF: "The Goldberg Variation")

results.name: Donald Edward Pankow
results.description: Donald Edward Pankow (played by Chasen Hampton) was the first known murder victim of Rob Roberts. Pankow tried to order food at a Costa Mesa Lucky Boy after the shop had closed, despite the "open" light being on. Pankow demanded that he receive service anyway. At the pickup window, he heard bizarre, disgusting sounds and peered inside, only to encounter Roberts and was promptly killed. Mulder and Scully learned that the body contained no brain matter. (TXF: "Hungry")

results.name: Donald Pfaster
results.description: Donald "Donnie" Addie Pfaster (played by Nick Chinlund) was a serial killer from Minneapolis. He initially seemed by all outward appearances an extraordinarily ordinary man, however, it soon became apparent that Donnie was a recluse and a "death fetishist".

results.name: Donald Trump
results.description: Donald Trump is the President of the United States in 2018. (TXF: "My Struggle III")

results.name: Doug Underwood
results.description: Doug Underwood (played by Erich Anderson) was the father of Billy and Josh and husband of Lisa Underwood. When Billy returned un-aged ten years after disappearing, Doug and Josh were very apprehensive, but Lisa was not. When they learned that the boy was a sort of apparition, Doug and his wife were finally able to have peace with their son's death. (TXF: "Invocation")

results.name: Duane Barry
results.description: Duane Barry (played by Steve Railsback) was a former FBI agent who claimed to have been repeatedly abducted by aliens. Duane Barry often referred to himself in the third person. (TXF: "Duane Barry", "Ascension")

results.name: Dwight Cooper
results.description: Dwight Cooper was a legally blind exterminator who came to realize that he could make far more money exterminating drug dealers than rats. His brother's gift of x-ray sight and his skill with a gun made Randall Cooper perfect for wiping out drug dealers on the orders of Dwight.

results.name: Dwight Eisenhower
results.description: Dwight Eisenhower (October 14, 1890 - March 28, 1969) was a famous World War II general and later the 34th President of the United States of America. Eisenhower Field was named after him. (TXF: "End Game")

results.name: Dyer
results.description: Dyer was a logger employed by the Schiff-Immergut Lumber Company. He often butted heads with his fellow logger, Perkins. When the loggers found themselves trapped at their remote camp by a swarm of unknown insects, Dyer suggested making a run for it. Although Perkins advised against it, the other men agreed, and deciding it was "every man for himself," the loggers broke and ran through the woods. Dyer and Perkins didn't get very far before they were attacked and killed by the insects.

results.name: Eddie Van Blundht
results.description: Eddie Van Blundht (played by Darin Morgan) was a janitor working for Dr. Alton Pugh in West Virginia who had been born with a tail, a common genetic trait in his family. He also possessed a bizarre amount of muscle tissue under the skin around his entire body, allowing him to alter his appearance at will. During high school, he dated Amanda Nelligan and the two of them frequently went to see Star Wars. Van Blundht's father was known as Eddie the Monkey Man and performed in a circus, a life Van Blundht didn't want and had his tail surgically removed. Upon the death of his father, Van Blundht preserved the body with quick-lime and kept the corpse in his attic so as not to stop drawing his father's old age pension.

results.name: Edmund Peacock
results.description: Edmund Peacock (played by Chris Nelson Norris) was a member of the Peacock family and brother and father to Sherman Peacock and George Peacock in Home, Pennsylvania, Pennsylvania. He was directly involved in the deaths of Andy Taylor, Barbara Taylor, and Barney Paster.

results.name: Edward Skur
results.description:
Skur was one of three test subjects, along with George Gissing and Terrill Oberman, implanted with a symbiotic organism. The procedure forced him to feed by having the organism, with the appearance of a spider, entering a victims mouth and feed by consuming all soft tissue and organs. The procedure had allegedly been performed on Skur by German scientists working for their new allied employers. The case became an X-file as part of covering it up. (TXF: "Travelers")
Skur killed a German doctor and agent Michel out of vengeance. Unable to control the symbiots hunger, he killed his wife.
Skur was apprehended by agent Dales and taken away by Bill Mulder. He was later released by Mulder who hoped that truth one day could be revealed.
In 1990, he rented a house in Caledonia, Wisconsin, and was to be evicted by the local sheriff. The sheriff found another victim in his bathtub before Skur attacked him. He was shot and fell down the stairs. Before dying he kept saying Mulder's name.

results.name: Elderly Gent
results.description: The Elderly Gent was an elderly male receptionist who worked at MacLaren Natatorium. He kept a new sign-in register for every day.

results.name: Ellen
results.description: Ellen was one of Special Agent Dana Scully's best friends. So close that Scully had been made godmother to Ellen's son Trent.

results.name: Ellen Adderly
results.description: Ellen Adderly (played by Michelle Joyner) was the wife of Phil Adderly and mother of their daughter. Unknown to herself, Adderly had a dissociative personality disorder that was able to manifest physically. Mulder was called in to investigate disappearance of her neighbor, Martha Crittendon, because of bizarre raven sightings seemingly connected to the crime. During the course of the investigation, during which Mulder stayed in the Adderly home, Mulder discovered that Ellen's husband had been having two affairs - one with Crittendon and one with Jenny Uphouse. Ellen was aware of her husband's infidelity, but denied herself any reaction to it to maintain the image of a perfect life. However, when Crittendon became pregnant, Ellen's other self killed her. Ellen first became aware that something about her was amiss when she discovered a stab wound in her shoulder that Jenny Uphouse inflicted while defending herself - futilely - against Adderly's other self. Mulder approached Adderly about this, but she promptly transformed again and tried to drown Mulder in a bathtub. However, Adderly was unable to comprehend seeing herself - there was a trail of broken mirrors and other reflective surfaces wherever she went - and saw her own reflection in the water while trying to drown Mulder. Shocked at seeing herself, she transformed back and cowered in a corner while Mulder recovered himself. Adderly was then committed in a mental hospital. (TXF: "Chimera")

results.name: Ellen Bledsoe
results.description: Doctor Ellen Bledsoe was a Medical Examiner who had an office at the National Bureau of Medical Examiners in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania in 1993 and was responsible for the autopsy of Howard Graves.

results.name: Ellen Reardon
results.description: Ellen Reardon was the surrogate mother of Cindy Reardon, however until 1994 she believed Cindy to be her genetic daughter (TXF: "Eve").

results.name: Elvis Presley
results.description: Elvis Presley (January 8, 1935 – August 16, 1977) was one of the most important figures in American rock and roll music during the 20th century. Elvis supposedly died in Memphis, Tennessee, but there are those who believe otherwise. Fox Mulder for example, believes that Elvis remains the only man to ever successfully fake his own death.

results.name: Enoch O'Connor
results.description: Enoch O'Connor (played by Michael Childers) was a reverend at the Church of God with Signs & Wonders and father of Gracie O'Connor. Mulder and Scully met him while investigating the death of Jared Chirp, who had been killed by multiple snake bites and O'Connor's church was known to practice snake handling with the belief that God would protect them from any danger. The agents learned that Chirp and Gracie left the church after Gracie became pregnant. However, Chirp learned that he was not the father, resulting in his being permanently silenced by Samuel Mackey. Mackey likewise attacked O'Connor with snakes, but O'Connor survived. Mulder discovered O'Connor attempting to kill Mackey and shot him. O'Connor survived, which was all the better since he was innocent all along, despite his fiery demeanor and confrontational disposition. (TXF: "Signs and Wonders")

results.name: Erika Price
results.description: Erika Price is a former member of the Syndicate, who along with Mr. Y are representatives of a new mysterious organization opposing the Cigarette Smoking Man.

results.name: Ernest Calderon
results.description: Doctor Ernest Calderon (played by Gerard Plunkett) was an alien/human hybrid who worked at the Prangen pharmaceuticals company and provided special medical services to a San Diego nursing home. (TXF: "Christmas Carol", "Emily")

results.name: Ernie Stefaniuk
results.description: Ernie Stefaniuk was a man who lived in Montana in the 1950s. He had a brother, [Myron Stefaniuk.

results.name: Erwin Timothy Lukesh
results.description: Erwin Timothy Lukesh was a serial killer who used a straight razor on his female victims and cut their tongues out. He would serve these tongues to his mother, the overly talkative and fearful Miriam Lukesh, in her sandwiches.

results.name: Esther Nairn
results.description: Invisigoth (real name Esther Nairn) was a computer genius who programmed the autonomous robots in the video game Ninjitsu Princess, which Lone Gunman Richard Langly described as, "the most gnarliest piece of entertainment software ever."

results.name: Eugene Victor Tooms
results.description: Eugene Victor Tooms was a genetic mutant serial killer who was capable of squeezing his body through narrow gaps; his unique muscle and bone structures allowed for extreme elongation and contortion of his body. He also had an incredibly low metabolic rate, allowing him to slip into hibernation periods lasting thirty years at a time. Between these periods of hibernation, Tooms would feed on human livers; usually five livers were consumed by murdering random citizens and removing the organ from each victim with his bare hands. Tooms would typically hibernate at the same location, in a nest made of newspaper strips glued together with his own bile. (TXF: "Squeeze", "Tooms")

results.name: Eve 6
results.description: Eve 6 was a clone from the Eve Series of clones created in the Lichfield Experiment. Like the other Eve clones in the original run she was extremely intelligent, had extraordinary strength and suffered from homicidal and suicidal tendencies.

results.name: Eve 8
results.description: Eve 8 was a clone from the Eve Series of clones created in the Lichfield Experiment. Like the other Eve clones in the original run she was extremely intelligent, had extraordinary strength and suffered from homicidal and suicidal tendencies.

results.name: Eve Series
results.description: The Eve Series was a group of identical female human clones designed to have superior intelligence and strength. A similar series was developed at the same time for human males, this group the Adam Series of clones.

results.name: First Elder
results.description: The First Elder (played by Don S. Williams) also known as the Well-Fed Man, and the Italian Man, was a high-ranking member of the Syndicate.

results.name: Flukeman
results.description: The Flukeman was a genetic mutant that found its way into the New Jersey sewer system and killed several people, before being washed up in Martha's Vineyard. (TXF: "The Host", "Pusher")

results.name: Fossa
results.description: Special Agent in Charge Fossa was a senior member of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. In 2008, she was part of an FBI team that consecutively searched for missing Agent Monica Bannan and then Cheryl Cunningham.

results.name: Fox Mulder
results.description: Fox William "Spooky" Mulder is a highly skilled FBI Special Agent who brought his often-criticized method of formulating unconventional theories to the X-files. (TXF: "Pilot", et al.)

results.name: Francis Pollidori
results.description: Dr. Francis Pollidori (played by John O'Hurley) was the scientist who created The Great Mutato. Pollidori believed was he permitted to engage in bizarre experimentation with genetics because he was able. In addition to The Great Mutato, he also created bizarre, disfigured flies.

results.name: Frank Black
results.description: Frank Black was a highly skilled criminal investigator within the Federal Bureau of Investigation who had the gift to put himself into the killer's mind and imagine himself as the killer. He had frequent dealings with the Millennium Group after he retired and moved to Seattle, Washington. (MM: "Pilot")

results.name: Frank Briggs
results.description: Briggs with FBI Agents Mulder and Scully.

results.name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
results.description: Franklin D. Roosevelt was President of the United States from 1933 to 1945. His wife was Eleanor Roosevelt. (TXF: "Small Potatoes") Roosevelt High School was named after him. (MM: "Somehow, Satan Got Behind Me")

results.name: Frank Nollette
results.description: Frank Nollette (played by James Sloyan) was a colleague of Dr. Arthur Grable who took credit for Grable's work after his death.

results.name: Franz Tomczeszyn
results.description: Franz Tomczeszyn was an employer at Donor Transport Services, wherein he was the employer of Janke Dacyshyn. Tomczeszyn was actually married to Dacyshyn and had a psychic connection to Father Joseph Crissman. In 2008, Tomczeszyn suffered from cancer, was badly injured as a result of being attacked and died following an aborted series of illegal attempts to transplant his head to a new body. (The X-Files: I Want to Believe)

results.name: Fraser
results.description: Fraser was a lieutenant serving under Calvin Henderson. He was the leader of Beta Team in Operation Falcon. When the extraterrestrial pilot of a crashed alien ship escaped a predefined perimeter in Townsend, Wisconsin, Beta Team was sent in to capture it. Fraser, Jackson and two other men encountered the alien, which turned out to be an energy creature, and it killed them.

results.name: G. Arnold
results.description: G. Arnold was an Assistant Director at the FBI, and member of the Office of Professional Review. (TXF: "The Beginning")

results.name: Garret Dale
results.affiliations:
Federal Bureau of Investigation
X-files unit
results.description: Garret Dale is one of the main characters in the spin-off mystery investigation game The X-Files: Deep State. He is an FBI agent partnered with the game's protagonist, Casey Winter.

results.name: Garry Shandling
results.description: Garry Shandling (played by himself) was an actor hired by Wayne Federman to star in The Lazarus Bowl as an FBI agent "loosely based" on Fox Mulder alongside Téa Leoni as a character based on Dana Scully. Mulder was not entirely pleased that he was to be portrayed by Shandling, hoping instead for Richard Gere. (TXF: "Hollywood A.D.")

results.name: Gary Lambert
results.description: Gary Lambert worked as a telemarketer in the corporation VinylRight.

results.name: Gene Crane
results.description: Gene Crane (played by Kirk B.R. Woller) was a Special Agent at the FBI.

results.name: Gene Gogolak
results.description: Gene Gogolak (played by Peter White) was the mastermind behind the creation of The Falls at Arcadia, a planned community with a strikingly strict set of rules for its residents. Gogolak was a businessman who worked for Pier 9 Imports and often traveled to the Far East to countries such as Tibet and Taiwan. While there, he apparently obtained the ability to summon a tulpa, which took the form as the Ubermenscher. Gogolak used the Ubermenscher to enforce his will upon the community, occasionally using it to kill resident who failed to conform, including Dave and Nancy Kline. When Rob and Laura Petrie moved in, Gogolak had Win Shroeder discern whatever he could about them. Ultimately, Gogolak had the Ubermenchser attack Mike Raskub for expressing concern over the Petries' safety. Mulder eventually figured out that Gogolak was behind the mysterious disappearances that occurred in the neighborhood, which prompted Gogolak to sic the Ubermenscher on him. However, Mulder handcuffed Gogolak to a mailbox while the Ubermenscher was on the prowl. Unable to control the being, Gogolak was attacked and killed by his own monster, which then caused the monster to cease existing. (TXF: "Arcadia")

results.name: George Bush
results.description: George Bush (born June 12, 1924) was the President of the United States from 1989 to 1993. His Vice President was Dan Quayle.

results.name: George Peacock
results.description: George Peacock was a member of the Peacock family and brother to Sherman Peacock and Edmund Peacock in Home, Pennsylvania, Pennsylvania. He was directly involved in the deaths of Andy Taylor, Barbara Taylor, and Barney Paster. He was killed when Mulder shot him at point-blank range. (TXF: "Home")

results.name: George W. Bush
results.description: George W. Bush (born July 6, 1946) was the President of the United States of America in the early 21st century. He took office in 2001, replacing Bill Clinton. (TXF: "Salvage") and was succeeded by Barack Obama. (TXF: "My Struggle")

results.name: Gerald Ford
results.description: Gerald R. Ford was the President of the United States of America during the mid-1970s. (TXF: "My Struggle")

results.name: Gerald Schnauz
results.description: Gerry Schnauz was a convicted criminal capable of psychic photography.

results.name: Gibson Praise
results.description: "Within"

results.name: Glenna
results.description: Glenna was the coroner that Special Agents Dana Scully and Fox Mulder dealt with during the investigation into the Jersey Devil.

results.name: Gracie O'Connor
results.description: Gracie O'Connor (played by Tracy Middendorf) was the daughter of Enoch O'Connor and a parishioner at the Church of God with Signs and Wonders. However, she left the church with her boyfriend, Jared Chirp, after she became pregnant. Mulder and Scully came to investigate after Chirp was killed by snakes that had been summoned by Samuel Mackey. Mackey, another reverend in Blessing, was the true father of Gracie's child, part of his scheme to destroy Enoch's church. Mackey killed Chirp, as well as Iris Finster, upon realizing the truth. Enoch and his parishioners induced labor for Gracie, who then gave birth not to a child - but to snakes. Gracie survived the ordeal, despite the psychological and physical trauma of the events. (TXF: "Signs and Wonders")

results.name: Gregor Series
results.description: Clones from the Gregor Series.

results.name: Greg Pincus
results.description: He was, in truth, a giant insect-like creature who infected his workers one by one, turning them into zombies. His reasons for doing so are never made clear. Gary Lambert, one of his employees, found out the truth and held Pincus and his zombies hostage one afternoon, demanding to be broadcast on TV so he could show the world that a monster walked among them.

results.name: Greta
results.description: Greta (played by Gretchen Becker) was a nurse who took care of the Cigarette Smoking Man in 2000. She was unable to stop Alex Krycek and Marita Covarrubias from throwing the Smoking Man down a flight of stairs in his wheelchair. (TXF: "Requiem")

results.name: Grey-Haired Man
results.description: The Grey-Haired Man (played by Morris Panych) was one of the Syndicate's hitmen. The man often attended Syndicate meetings.

results.name: Guy Mann
results.description: Guy Mann is the pseudonym of a lizard creature.

results.name: Gwen Goodensnake
results.description: Gwen Goodensnake (played by Renae Morriseau) was a Trego Native American who lived on the Trego Indian Reservation with her brother, Joseph.

results.name: Hank Gulatarski
results.description: Hank Gulatarski (played by David Barry Gray) was a backpacker who found his way to a cult in Utah while en route to Colorado where he witnessed a disabled man be stoned to death. A parasite was then removed from his body and introduced to Gulatarski's, where it took up residence in his spine. Dana Scully began investigating the murder and also found her way to the cult and was asked to treat Gulatarski, who had been listed as missing. She discovered the parasite and realized she was dealing with a religious cult and tried to escape. However, Gulatarski gave in to the cultists and was also stoned to death. (TXF: "Roadrunners")

results.name: Harden
results.description: Sheriff Harden (played by Tom Bower) was a sheriff and father of Max Harden. With help from Agents Mulder and Scully, he investigated the brutal murder of Ronald Foster. Although Anthony Reed was the prime suspect, his own son Max was the true killer. He refused to believe this until he discovered the flashlight used to bludgeon Foster in his son's room. Upon this discovery, Max nearly killed his father by a tremendous blow to the abdomen, causing injury and internal bleeding. Harden went to the hospital, but would survive. (TXF: "Rush")

results.name: Harold Piller
results.description: Harold Piller (played by Anthony Heald) claimed to be a psychic who assisted in police investigations. He had done thorough research into his power and was known to have assisted in the search for missing children's bodies in Kashmir, India following a horrific train accident. He also had a history of mental illness and schizophrenia, which he neglected to tell Mulder and Scully about when he arrived to help find Amber Lynn LaPierre. Mulder gave Piller more credence than Scully and allowed him to participate in the investigation, during which Piller discovered a connection between the LaPierre case and Samantha Mulder. One night, Piller demanded Mulder's attention and claimed that his mother was present and needed to convey something to Mulder. Mulder began to lose faith in Piller, but discovered that he had somehow written down "April Base" without even knowing it. Mulder and Piller went to the Air Force base and were led to the house where Samantha lived while a subject of the Project with Jeffrey Spender. Ultimately, Mulder was able to contact Samantha in a strange, mystical manner and give him closure over her disappearance and death. Mulder also encountered Piller's son, whom Piller had been searching for and was still a suspect in his disappearance. Although Mulder had finally achieved closure, Piller didn't as he could not accept that his son was dead. (TXF: "Closure")

results.name: Heitz Werber
results.description: Heitz Werber was a doctor who conducted hypnosis on several abductees, including Billy Miles, Cassandra Spender and Dana Scully. (TXF: "Pilot", "Patient X", "The Red and the Black")

results.name: Henderson
results.description: Henderson was a handwriting analyst who worked for the Federal Bureau of Investigation, at FBI Headquarters. She was a friend of Special Agent Fox Mulder and, in 1994, she analyzed several taunting notes that criminal John Barnett had written for him, in an effort to determine who had written the notes before the culprit's identity was discerned by the FBI. (TXF: "Young at Heart")

results.name: Henry Weems
results.description: Henry Weems (played by Willie Garson) was a Chicago resident cursed with extraordinary good luck.

results.name: Herman Pinchbeck
results.description: Herman Pinchbeck (played by Ricky Jay) was the brother of Albert Pinchbeck and known by his stage name as The Amazing Maleeni. Herman and Albert used to perform magic together, but Albert quit to work at a Cradock Marine bank, leaving Herman on his own. In 2000, Albert died of a coronary. Pinchbeck and his protege, Billy LaBonge, developed an elaborate scheme involving a fantastic magic trick leading to a massive bank robbery. LaBonge heckled Pinchbeck, who was then able to rotate his head 360 degrees around his neck. However, the head trick was performed using Albert's body, prompting an investigation by Mulder and Scully.

results.name: Holly
results.description: Holly was a government worker for the Federal Bureau of Investigation. She worked in the Computer Records Office.

results.name: Howard Crittendon
results.description: Howard Crittendon (played by Charles Hoyes) was the husband of Martha Crittendon and father of Michelle Crittendon. He was understandably distraught after his wife, who had been having an affair with Phil Adderly, was murdered by Ellen Adderly. However, he was further traumatized by discovering his wife's corpse in the rose garden outside his home. The Crittendon family lived in Vermont. (TXF: "Chimera")

results.name: Howard Graves
results.description: Howard Graves was a high level executive at HTG Industrial Technologies that died not long before a series of strange deaths occurred around his secretary, Lauren Kyte.

results.name: Ian Detweiler
results.description: Ian Detweiller (played by Andrew Robinson) was a cryptozoologist who tracked and caught a wanshang dhole in China in 1999. However, he was somehow transformed into the creature himself. He attempted to hide his condition but would morph into the wolf-like being each night and viciously killed a number of victims after arriving in the United States aboard the T'ien Kou. Mulder and Scully were tracking the creature with Detwiler's supposed aid, but figured out his true identity with help from Karin Berquist. He was killed while attempting to kill Berquist when he lunged at her, throwing both out of a window. Detweiler was impaled on a post below. (TXF: "Alpha")

results.name: Iris Finster
results.description: Iris Finster (played by Beth Grant) was a parishioner at the church of reverend Samuel Mackey in Blessing, Tennessee. She was able to figure out the truth concerning Gracie O'Connor and Jared Chirp. Thus, she was killed by snakes summoned by Mackey himself. (TXF: "Signs and Wonders")

results.name: Irving Thalbro
results.description: Irving Thalbro (played by Tom Dahlgren) was a doctor and father of Nan Wieder, who was married to Dr. Robert Wieder. After Wieder won an award for the Bay Area Physician of the Year in 2000, Thalbro discovered a hexcraft sign on his bed. Shortly thereafter, Wieder discovered his father-in-law's corpse hanging from a noose and with his throat slit. The word "theef" (a misspelling of "thief") was found on the wall in Thalbro's blood. It was later found out that Thalbro was killed by Orell Peattie using a poppet. (TXF: "Theef")

results.name: Isaac Luria
results.description: Isaac Luria (played by Harrison Coe) was a Jewish store owner in Brooklyn who was brutally murdered as part of a hate crime. He was shot five times at point-blank range by Tony Oliver, Clinton Bascombe, and their accomplices. Luria was engaged to marry Ariel Luria, daughter of Jacob Weiss. After Luria's death and burial at the Ben Zion Cemetery, Ariel successfully conjured a golem in Luria's likeness that began seeking revenge on his killers. (TXF: "Kaddish")

results.name: Ish
results.description: In 1946, he was returning home from fishing at Cut Bank Creek when he took a shortcut behind Watkins house. He heard a strange groan and looked into the house, where he saw Watkins transforming into a manitou. After Watkins saw him, Ish ran home.

results.name: Ivan Martinez
results.description: Ivan Martinez (played by Jamie Marsh) was a computer programmer and mastermind of FPS. He worked with Phoebe as well as The Lone Gunmen on the project until the death of Retro while playing against Maitreya. After Mulder and Scully investigated the game and Phoebe seemingly destroyed it, Martinez was despondent until the computer showed a flicker of life. (TXF: "First Person Shooter")

results.name: Jack
results.description: Jack was a homeless man that Special Agent Fox Mulder encountered when he went to Atlantic City following rumors of the Jersey Devil.

results.name: Jackie Gurwitch
results.description: Jackie Gurwitch (played by Tuesday Knight) was the sister of June Gurwitch and aunt/adopted mother of Trevor Andrew Rawls. When Wilson Pinker Rawls escaped from prison in search of his son, he went to Jackie but was unaware that Trevor was in her care. Upon learning this, he returned and attempted to leave with Trevor but was stopped by Mulder and Scully. Jackie tried to splatter Pinker with boiling soup, but it passed right through him.(TXF: "Trevor")

results.name: Jackson
results.description: Jackson was a soldier serving under Calvin Henderson. He was part of Beta Team in Operation Falcon. When the extraterrestrial pilot of a crashed alien ship escaped a predefined perimeter in Townsend, Wisconsin, Beta Team was sent in to capture it. Jackson accompanied Lieutenant Fraser into an abandoned parking garage with two other soldiers where they encounter the alien, which killed all four men with a concentrated blast of blinding white energy.

results.name: Jackson Van De Kamp
results.portrayedby: Miles Robbins. Hannah, Aiden, and Rowan Longworth (siblings). Many babies, the first being Jerry Shiban.
results.description: Jackson Van De Kamp, was born William Scully [1] the son of Dana Scully. He was long thought, for 17 years, to be the biological child of Fox Mulder. However, in the series finale the Cigarette Smoking Man claimed to be his biological father and "creator" (TXF: “My Struggle III”). While this seems definitive, all the characters are given is the Cigarette Smoking Man's word, and due to the convoluted nature of the mythology arc there is as much evidence that negates this supposed truth as supports it. In the context of the whole series it seems more realistic, that the Cigarette Smoking Man's experiments on William before his birth might have been derived from whatever he did with Jeffrey Spender and maybe what he learnt when he tried to transfer Mulder's immunity on himself. (TXF: "The Sixth Extinction II: Amor Fati”). The experiments with William were more related to super-soldiers (USS Valor Victory), an attempt for the aliens to turn William into one of their own. (TXF: "Nothing Important Happened Today II", "Trust No 1", "William", "The Truth").

results.name: Jack Willis
results.description: Jack Willis was an employee of the Federal Bureau of Investigation – first as an instructor at the FBI Academy, then as an FBI Special Agent. In 1994, he was shot by criminal Warren Dupre, whose personality subsequently inhabited Willis' body while Willis' own personality was almost entirely lost. Jack Willis was also diabetic. (TXF: "Lazarus")

results.name: Jade Blue Afterglow
results.description: Jade Blue Afterglow (played by Krista Allen) was a stripper who was paid to be digitally scanned by Phoebe and used as a model for Maitreya. She was interviewed by Mulder and Scully concerning the death of Retro, but it was obvious that she had nothing to do with it. She claimed that "Jade Blue Afterglow" was indeed her real name, but Scully doubted this. (TXF: "First Person Shooter")

results.name: Jana Cassidy
results.description: Assistant Director Jana Cassidy was a high-ranking official in the Federal Bureau of Investigation and its Office of Professional Review. (The X-Files Movie)

results.name: Jane Doe
results.description: Jane Doe is the main antagonist in the spin-off mystery investigation game The X-Files: Deep State. She is an enigmatic government agent of unknown rank, pursuing some sinister goal with absolute ruthfulness.

results.name: Janet Draper
results.description: Captain Janet Draper was a United States Army officer who served as the Adjutant to Major General Thomas Callahan, Commanding General, Fort Evanston Army Hospital in Maryland.

results.name: Janet Wilson
results.description: Janet Wilson (played by Bellamy Young) was the defense attorney given the murder case involving Martin Wells in 2000. She was completely unaware of his unusual time travel experience that allowed him to save his wife's life and thus never meet her. Wilson was described as a brilliant attorney. (TXF: "Redrum")

results.name: Jared Chirp
results.description: Jared Chirp (played by Eric Nenninger) was a parishioner at the Church of God with Signs & Wonders and boyfriend of Gracie O'Connor. Gracie became pregnant, and she and Chirp left the church, whose reverend was Gracie's father, Enoch O'Connor. However, Chirp discovered through medical test results that he was not the father. Before he could tell everyone the truth, however, he was killed by multiple snake bites summoned by Samuel Mackey. (TXF: "Signs and Wonders")

results.name: Jason Ludwig
results.description: Jason Ludwig was a robotic engineer who became trapped in Mount Avalon and infected by the Silicon based parasite, alongside his partners Peter Tanaka and Jessie O'Neil. He attacked Mulder when he entered the CVR team office. Later, he was shot and killed by Daniel Trepkos, with a flare gun. (TXF: "Firewalker")

results.name: Jason McPeck
results.description: Jason McPeck (played by Cory Parravano) was the son of Irene McPeck and Cameron McPeck and lived in Goochland, Virginia. He was diagnosed with cancer but his parents denied him any medical treatment because of their strong religious belief that God would heal him. This became a local media sensation, bringing throngs of protesters to the McPeck home. During one night, a blinding light appeared outside of McPeck's window, which he believed to be that of an angel. A group of men in suits approached him and he was "miraculously" healed the following morning. Agent Scully met McPeck and his family. The only sign of his cure was a pinch mark on the back of his neck where an implant had been inserted by agents of the Cigarette Smoking Man. (TXF: "En Ami")

results.name: Jason Wright
results.description: Jason Wright was a sheriff's deputy in Townsend, Wisconsin. He was married with a son.

results.name: Jay Gilmore
results.description: Jay Gilmore (played by Paul Hayes) was the boss of a storage unit facility in Missouri. One of his employees, Anson Stokes, discovered a Jinni in one of the units. Because Gilmore had been on Stokes's case about getting to work, Stokes wished that Gilmore would "just shut up." The Jinni then covered Gilmore's mouth with skin, preventing him from speaking. The incident attracted the attention of Fox Mulder. Gilmore subsequently had surgery to allow him to speak again. (TXF: "Je Souhaite")

results.name: Jay Nemman
results.description: Doctor Jay Namman was a County Medical Examiner for Bellefleur, Oregon.

results.name: J. Edgar Hoover
results.description: J. Edgar Hoover (1895-1972) was the first Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and was famous for his ardent anti-communism. (TXF: "Travelers").

results.name: Jeffrey Spender
results.description: Jeffrey Frank Spender was the son of the Cigarette Smoking Man and Cassandra Spender, as well as the paternal half-brother of Fox Mulder. He worked as a Special Agent in the FBI (wherein he was, at one point, assigned to the X-Files Unit, partnered with Special Agent Diana Fowley), until being shot by his father and subjected to medical experiments that disfigured him to the point of being unrecognizable. (TXF: "Patient X", et al.)

results.name: Jenny Uphouse
results.description: Jenny Uphouse (played by Gina Mastrogiacomo) was a Vermont resident who had an affair with Phil Adderly, despite the fact he was married to Ellen Adderly. It was well known in the neighborhood that she and Martha Crittendon did not get along together. Uphouse worked at diner and was seemingly of a lower class than her neighbors, which apparently was part of their disagreement. When Adderly was able to manifest into a vicious being after being aware of her husband's infidelity for some time, she killed Crittendon. Uphouse was interviewed by Agent Mulder, who ruled her out as a suspect. After spending a night with Phil Adderly, Uphouse was killed the next day by his wife, but not before stabbing her in the shoulder with a shard of glass from a shattered mirror. Uphouse had a child whose name and paternity was not revealed. (TXF: "Chimera")

results.name: Jeremiah Smith
results.description: Jeremiah Smith (played by Roy Thinnes) was a hybrid clone and a member of the resistance against the Syndicate who exhibited healing and shapeshifting abilities. He gained public attention after saving the lives of several people following a shooting in a fast food restaurant. It would seem that this Jeremiah Smith was one of six clones who all worked at the Social Security Administration in different states. This Smith, who worked in Washington, D.C., was captured by the Syndicate and held for execution by the Alien Bounty Hunter, but was able to escape by dealing with the Cigarette-Smoking Man, offering to heal his lung cancer and be set free.
