results.description: Walt Eubanks was a Special Agent in Charge in the Federal Bureau of Investigation. In 1995, he was part of an FBI team that searched for teenage abductee Amy Jacobs. (TXF: "Oubliette")

results.name: Wanshang dhole
results.description: A wanshang dhole was a previously believed to be extinct breed of dog, native to China.

results.name: Wayne Federman
results.description: Wayne Federman (played by himself) was a college buddy of Walter Skinner who approached "Skin-Man" to direct a movie based on an X-File. Skinner obliged and permitted Federman to tag along with Mulder as he investigated a church bombing. The bombing led to an investigation of Micah Hoffman, who apparently created forged religious documents that he sold to Cardinal Augustine O'Fallon. Eventually Federman returned to Los Angeles to make his movie, entitled The Lazarus Bowl, starring Garry Shandling as Mulder, Téa Leoni as Scully, and supposedly Richard Gere as Skinner. The agents attended the premiere of the movie, but were thoroughly disappointed with its comical depiction of events. (TXF: "Hollywood A.D.")

results.name: Wayne Weinsider
results.description: Wayne Weinsider in demon form.

results.name: Well-Manicured Man
results.description: The Well-Manicured Man (played by John Neville) was a member of the Syndicate. Without his group's authorization, he secretly helped FBI Special Agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully, partners assigned to the X-files, in the 1990s. (TXF: "The Blessing Way", et al.) The Well-Manicured Man had at least one grandson and resided (at least temporarily) in Somerset, England. (The X-Files: Fight the Future)

results.name: William Glass
results.description: William Glass was a Doctor based in Raymon County who treated Billy Miles, Ray Soames and Peggy O'Dell at Oregon Memorial Psychiatric Hospital, the state psychiatric hospital in Raymon County.

results.name: William Scully (father)
results.description: William Scully was a captain in the US Navy and a member of the Scully family. (TXF: "Beyond the Sea", "One Son") He was the husband of Margaret Scully, the father of William Scully, Jr. as well as Dana, Melissa and Charles Scully, and the grandfather of Matthew Scully and Dana's son, William. (TXF: "Beyond the Sea", et al.) He never met his grandchildren, however, as they were born years after he died of a heart attack in early 1994. (TXF: "Beyond the Sea")

results.name: William Scully, Jr.
results.description: William Scully, Jr. (Bill) was the son of William and Margaret Scully and brother to Dana, Melissa, and Charles. (citation required) He was the eldest of the Scully children. (citation required) He and his wife Tara have a son named Matthew.

results.name: William Secare
results.description: William Secare was a doctor and a human-alien hybrid.

results.name: Wilson Pinker Rawls
results.description: Wilson Pinker Rawls (played by John Diehl), also known as Pinker and Pinkie was a convicted criminal in Mississippi who had the ability to pass through solid matter that could conduct electricity. He once had a relationship with June Gurwitch and fathered a child with her named Trevor. However, Trevor was born after Pinker was convicted and sent to prison in 1992 for a wire office robbery in Bay Saint Louis, Mississippi.

results.name: Win Shroeder
results.description: Win Shroeder (played by Tom Gallop) was the husband of Cami Shroeder and resident of The Falls at Arcadia. He was a loyal resident who helped Gene Gogolak enforce the many rules of the neighborhood. He helped Rob and Laura Petrie move in. The next day, Rob planted a pink flamingo in the yard which was promptly removed. He also vandalized his own mailbox, which was also repaired almost immediately. Inside the mailbox was a warning not to break any more rules. That evening, Shroeder caught Rob (Mulder) playing basketball and hurriedly put the hoop away. Shroeder, growing uneasy with next-door neighbors, was horrified to discover a blown bulb in his lamppost. Shroeder quickly replaced it before the Ubermenscher could arrive. He suspected that the bulb had been sabotaged by Gogolak, which was exactly the plan of Mike Raskub, who had been attacked by the Ubermenscher and was seeking revenge. After the deaths of Raskub and Gogolak, Shroeder learned of the Petries' true identities and continued to live at The Falls. (TXF: "Arcadia")

results.name: Wood mite
results.description: Wood mites in and out of shadow.

results.name: Worshiped spinal parasite
results.description: The worshiped spinal parasite was a kind of gastropod parasite that was worshiped by a cult who believed it was the second coming of Jesus Christ. FBI Special Agent Dana Scully encountered the mollusc when she was treating Hank Gulatarski, who was one of the hosts for the creature. Hank was stoned to death after Scully failed to remove it. The parasite was transferred to Scully. However, Special Agent Doggett arrived and removed the parasite from Scully's body before finally shooting the parasite to death. (TXF: "Roadrunners")

results.name: X
results.description: "X" was the codename for one of Fox Mulder's informants and a member of the Men in Black. Although X's real name was never revealed, he became known as "X" or "Mr. X" because Mulder would seek his assistance by marking an "X" in masking tape on his apartment window.

results.name: Yappi
results.description: Yappi (better known as the Stupendous Yappi) was a celebrity who often made appearances in filmed media, such as on television. (TXF: "Clyde Bruckman's Final Repose", "José Chung's From Outer Space")

results.name: Ybarra
results.description: Father Ybarra (played by Adam Godley) is the chief Priest from Our Lady of Sorrows Hospital. Ybarra didn't agree with Dana Scully to make the cell stem treatment to her sick patient, Christian Fearon. (TXF: The X-Files: I Want to Believe)

results.name: Yves Adele Harlow
results.description: Yves Adele Harlow (real name Lois Runce) was a mysterious hacker who often worked with The Lone Gunmen from 2000 to 2002. (TLG: "Pilot"; TXF: "Jump the Shark") Her pseudonym was an anagram of "Lee Harvey Oswald." (TLG: "Pilot")

results.name: Zenzola
results.description: Dr. Zenzola was a physician in Newark, New Jersey who treated Craig for his injuries following his attack in the sewers by a mysterious creature. She explained to Fox Mulder that she was uncertain what had attacked Craig, but that she'd given the patient gum to chew to help with a bad taste in his mouth as well as a treatment of antibiotics for any bacteria he may have picked up while immersed in the sewer water fighting with the creature. She also showed Mulder the bizarre bite wound on the man's back.
